issue.title: Not getting updates/website detecting Adblocker every time now

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://gaypornhdfree.com/?ref=mygaysites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
I have uninstalled and reinstalled the Adguard app multiple times could doing that interfere with getting updates? Or could that cause the base filter that Alex added a new code specifically for gaypornhdfree.com to no longer work? My iPhone is iPhone 7 Plus operating system 15.7.1 safari version 15.7.1

All I know is now if I click the updating button on the adguard app it saids no updates found. And the website is now detecting my adblocker every time no matter how many refreshes of the page I do. Could someone also please tell me what are the exact filters I must have enabled for in safari protection of the app in order for the added code Alex did to work? 

I have set up the six Adguard extensions on settings-safari of Aduard custom-Adguard general-Aduard other-Adguard privacy-Adguard security-Adguard-social 

each one is enabled 

I have gone to gaypornhdfree.com selected the aA icon on the left of the url bar of safari picked manage extensions and made sure adguard was enabled for advanced protection

I also clicked on adguard on the list shown when you click aA and checked to make sure safari protection specifically for that website is enabled

I have went also to setting-safari and selected

delete history and website data I have also selected close tabs afterwards 


I have added the user rule that Alex told me to add I have done everything I believe I was told of the exact order

but just in case could someone please direct me to the steps again of the exact order 

to make sure I have not missed a step or done it in the wrong order





2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

If someone could please respond of the exact order of the steps needed for this to work I could implement then immediately 


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
This issue occurs only in nightly build 7.12 and it's related to this - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/Scriptlets/issues/264
As far as I understand, issue with incorrect blocking has been fixed, but new scriptlets library wasn't added to nightly version yet.
There are also issues with `prevent-fetch` and `prevent-xhr` which also have been fixed (fix is not implemented in nightly version).
If I'm not wrong, few other scriptlets also might not work correctly - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/Scriptlets/issues/268 and it's not fixed yet.

As a temporary solution this rule should works:
```adblock
tvp.pl,tvp.info,swipeto.pl#@%#//scriptlet('prevent-element-src-loading', 'script', 'hit.gemius.pl')
```

issue.body:

comment.body:
As I recall, it sometimes is also used for ads/popups and according to this - https://www.malwarebytes.com/blog/detections/cdn77-org some subdomains are used for phishing/malware, so maybe it's not required to exclude it from a `/^(?!.*(bootstrapcdn` rule.
At least until there will be obvious breakage, but blocking `*.rsc.cdn77.org` is a bad idea, because it breaks some websites.
Maybe `cdn77.org` should be excluded from the `/^(?!.*(bootstrapcdn` lockdown too? I have seen it's blocked by the rule somewhere, tho no obvious breakage IIRC.e

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Mass update to the GitHub report form to better accomodate AGH and uBO users
issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [ ] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure. (I was unsure how this PR would affect the AdGuard site's report form and adguard-bot's color labels, if at all.)

## What problem does the pull request fix?

Missing lists, extensions, and tools where it is feasible to expect that AdGuard Filters lists are used by end-users.

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [x] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons ‚Äî share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances ‚Äî pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

A fair few issues where users were supposed to pick "Other" or custom text for various questions, despite them frequently being used in setups where AdGuard Filters lists are being used.

The "Allow edits by maintainers" button has been turned on for this PR, enabling you guys to make any changes to the PR without having to ask me to do them for you.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

The report form, when initiated from GitHub's GUI, lacks options for things that are reasonable (or even probable) to expect to be used in user settings, including:
‚Ä¢ 2 of the new split-up AdGuard Annoyances lists.
‚Ä¢ AdGuard Home user environments.
‚Ä¢ uBlock Origin configurations, as well as non-regional lists that are included in uBO but not in AdGuard.
‚Ä¢ Vivaldi, a browser that is doing reasonably well as of late 2022.
‚Ä¢ AdGuard's *Browsing Security* module.
‚Ä¢ "Fanboy's Notifications Blocking List" for good measure.

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

N/A, from what I can tell at the time of writing.

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
In addition, AdGuard Base can disappear from the "Ads" section in uBo to avoid conflations with files: filters*.txt

Which will leave a list of mobile, social media, annoyance and some regional.

issue.title: Not getting updates/website detecting Adblocker every time now

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://gaypornhdfree.com/?ref=mygaysites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
I have uninstalled and reinstalled the Adguard app multiple times could doing that interfere with getting updates? Or could that cause the base filter that Alex added a new code specifically for gaypornhdfree.com to no longer work? My iPhone is iPhone 7 Plus operating system 15.7.1 safari version 15.7.1

All I know is now if I click the updating button on the adguard app it saids no updates found. And the website is now detecting my adblocker every time no matter how many refreshes of the page I do. Could someone also please tell me what are the exact filters I must have enabled for in safari protection of the app in order for the added code Alex did to work? 

I have set up the six Adguard extensions on settings-safari of Aduard custom-Adguard general-Aduard other-Adguard privacy-Adguard security-Adguard-social 

each one is enabled 

I have gone to gaypornhdfree.com selected the aA icon on the left of the url bar of safari picked manage extensions and made sure adguard was enabled for advanced protection

I also clicked on adguard on the list shown when you click aA and checked to make sure safari protection specifically for that website is enabled

I have went also to setting-safari and selected

delete history and website data I have also selected close tabs afterwards 


I have added the user rule that Alex told me to add I have done everything I believe I was told of the exact order

but just in case could someone please direct me to the steps again of the exact order 

to make sure I have not missed a step or done it in the wrong order





2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

If someone could please respond of the exact order of the steps needed for this to work I could implement then immediately 


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
As for me, these two simple filters that Alex added can not be removed permanently by uninstalling the application.

They will come right back with a fresh download of AdGuard Base.

After the message about "no update", try leaving the AdGuard application active for a minute and then only open the browser.

issue.title: Not getting updates/website detecting Adblocker every time now

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://gaypornhdfree.com/?ref=mygaysites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
I have uninstalled and reinstalled the Adguard app multiple times could doing that interfere with getting updates? Or could that cause the base filter that Alex added a new code specifically for gaypornhdfree.com to no longer work? My iPhone is iPhone 7 Plus operating system 15.7.1 safari version 15.7.1

All I know is now if I click the updating button on the adguard app it saids no updates found. And the website is now detecting my adblocker every time no matter how many refreshes of the page I do. Could someone also please tell me what are the exact filters I must have enabled for in safari protection of the app in order for the added code Alex did to work? 

I have set up the six Adguard extensions on settings-safari of Aduard custom-Adguard general-Aduard other-Adguard privacy-Adguard security-Adguard-social 

each one is enabled 

I have gone to gaypornhdfree.com selected the aA icon on the left of the url bar of safari picked manage extensions and made sure adguard was enabled for advanced protection

I also clicked on adguard on the list shown when you click aA and checked to make sure safari protection specifically for that website is enabled

I have went also to setting-safari and selected

delete history and website data I have also selected close tabs afterwards 


I have added the user rule that Alex told me to add I have done everything I believe I was told of the exact order

but just in case could someone please direct me to the steps again of the exact order 

to make sure I have not missed a step or done it in the wrong order





2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

If someone could please respond of the exact order of the steps needed for this to work I could implement then immediately 


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: Mass update to the GitHub report form to better accomodate AGH and uBO users
issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [ ] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure. (I was unsure how this PR would affect the AdGuard site's report form and adguard-bot's color labels, if at all.)

## What problem does the pull request fix?

Missing lists, extensions, and tools where it is feasible to expect that AdGuard Filters lists are used by end-users.

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [x] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons ‚Äî share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances ‚Äî pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

A fair few issues where users were supposed to pick "Other" or custom text for various questions, despite them frequently being used in setups where AdGuard Filters lists are being used.

The "Allow edits by maintainers" button has been turned on for this PR, enabling you guys to make any changes to the PR without having to ask me to do them for you.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

The report form, when initiated from GitHub's GUI, lacks options for things that are reasonable (or even probable) to expect to be used in user settings, including:
‚Ä¢ 2 of the new split-up AdGuard Annoyances lists.
‚Ä¢ AdGuard Home user environments.
‚Ä¢ uBlock Origin configurations, as well as non-regional lists that are included in uBO but not in AdGuard.

‚Ä¢ "Fanboy's Notifications Blocking List" for good measure.

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

N/A, from what I can tell at the time of writing.

_No response_

All I know is now if I click the updating button on the adguard app it saids no updates found. And the website is now detecting my adblocker every time no matter how many refreshes of the page I do. Could someone also please tell me what are the exact filters I must have enabled for in safari protection of the app in order for the added code Alex did to work?

each one is enabled 

I have gone to gaypornhdfree.com selected the aA icon on the left of the url bar of safari picked manage extensions and made sure adguard was enabled for advanced protection

I also clicked on adguard on the list shown when you click aA and checked to make sure safari protection specifically for that website is enabled

I have went also to setting-safari and selected

delete history and website data I have also selected close tabs afterwards 


I have added the user rule that Alex told me to add I have done everything I believe I was told of the exact order

but just in case could someone please direct me to the steps again of the exact order

### Prerequisites

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://gaypornhdfree.com/?ref=mygaysites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
I have uninstalled and reinstalled the Adguard app multiple times could doing that interfere with getting updates? Or could that cause the base filter that Alex added a new code specifically for gaypornhdfree.com to no longer work? My iPhone is iPhone 7 Plus operating system 15.7.1 safari version 15.7.1

All I know is now if I click the updating button on the adguard app it saids no updates found. And the website is now detecting my adblocker every time no matter how many refreshes of the page I do. Could someone also please tell me what are the exact filters I must have enabled for in safari protection of the app in order for the added code Alex did to work? 

I have set up the six Adguard extensions on settings-safari of Aduard custom-Adguard general-Aduard other-Adguard privacy-Adguard security-Adguard-social 

each one is enabled 

I have gone to gaypornhdfree.com selected the aA icon on the left of the url bar of safari picked manage extensions and made sure adguard was enabled for advanced protection

I also clicked on adguard on the list shown when you click aA and checked to make sure safari protection specifically for that website is enabled

I have went also to setting-safari and selected

delete history and website data I have also selected close tabs afterwards 


I have added the user rule that Alex told me to add I have done everything I believe I was told of the exact order

but just in case could someone please direct me to the steps again of the exact order 

to make sure I have not missed a step or done it in the wrong order





2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

If someone could please respond of the exact order of the steps needed for this to work I could implement then immediately

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
> it causes the subtitles on hulu to be out of sync

That's because we block video ad, but subtitles has hardcoded pauses for ads. Please add this rule:
```
hulu.com#@%#//scriptlet('json-prune', 'breaks pause_ads')
```

comment.body: I think it was a sign of a much deeper bug of some kind as at some point I noticed that Adguard had ceased filtering anything in any browser - the filtering log showed nothing no matter what page I loaded and Adguard itself showed no errors. Fully existing then restarting Adguard did nothing. Starting a completely different browser that hadn't been running did nothing. Adguard was all green and seemed to think it was running perfectly fine (the logs show no errors) yet it was doing absolutely nothing. The only thing that worked was a full system reboot.

issue.title: Mass update to the GitHub report form to better accomodate AGH and uBO users
issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [ ] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure. (I was unsure how this PR would affect the AdGuard site's report form and adguard-bot's color labels, if at all.)

## What problem does the pull request fix?

Missing lists, extensions, and tools where it is feasible to expect that AdGuard Filters lists are used by end-users.

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [x] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons ‚Äî share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances ‚Äî pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

A fair few issues where users were supposed to pick "Other" or custom text for various questions, despite them frequently being used in setups where AdGuard Filters lists are being used.

The "Allow edits by maintainers" button has been turned on for this PR, enabling you guys to make any changes to the PR without having to ask me to do them for you.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

The report form, when initiated from GitHub's GUI, lacks options for things that are reasonable (or even probable) to expect to be used in user settings, including:
‚Ä¢ 2 of the new split-up AdGuard Annoyances lists.
‚Ä¢ AdGuard Home user environments.
‚Ä¢ uBlock Origin configurations, as well as non-regional lists that are included in uBO but not in AdGuard.
‚Ä¢ Vivaldi, a browser that is doing reasonably well as of late 2022.
‚Ä¢ AdGuard's *Browsing Security* module.
‚Ä¢ "Fanboy's Notifications Blocking List" for good measure.

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

comment.body:
>https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uBlock-issues/issues/2376#issuecomment-1322321194

If Gorhill follows through with that, I would riot. I have used AdGuard Base for 4 years, and I have ***never*** seen the kind of incompatibilities he keeps talking about. The amount of times AdGuard Base correctly blocked something that neither EasyList or uAssets blocked at the time, outnumber any incompatibilities 1000:1.

issue.title: Mass update to the GitHub report form to better accomodate AGH and uBO users
issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [ ] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure. (I was unsure how this PR would affect the AdGuard site's report form and adguard-bot's color labels, if at all.)

## What problem does the pull request fix?

Missing lists, extensions, and tools where it is feasible to expect that AdGuard Filters lists are used by end-users.

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [x] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons ‚Äî share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances ‚Äî pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

A fair few issues where users were supposed to pick "Other" or custom text for various questions, despite them frequently being used in setups where AdGuard Filters lists are being used.

The "Allow edits by maintainers" button has been turned on for this PR, enabling you guys to make any changes to the PR without having to ask me to do them for you.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

The report form, when initiated from GitHub's GUI, lacks options for things that are reasonable (or even probable) to expect to be used in user settings, including:
‚Ä¢ 2 of the new split-up AdGuard Annoyances lists.
‚Ä¢ AdGuard Home user environments.
‚Ä¢ uBlock Origin configurations, as well as non-regional lists that are included in uBO but not in AdGuard.
‚Ä¢ Vivaldi, a browser that is doing reasonably well as of late 2022.
‚Ä¢ AdGuard's *Browsing Security* module.
‚Ä¢ "Fanboy's Notifications Blocking List" for good measure.

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

N/A, from what I can tell at the time of writing.

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uBlock-issues/issues/2376#issuecomment-1322321194

> I am thinking of removing AdGuard Base from uBO's stock lists. (...) at a time when uBO did not have its own solid well maintained lists.

I assume it won't go to the "badlists" file (https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/blob/master/filters/badlists.txt), that would be too much of a penalty - although it is possible to deliberately circumvent this mechanism with, for example, an empty parameter at the end of the URL.

As "filters*.txt I meant these:

![obraz](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35370833/206794899-3c0447e1-3713-4b80-8975-2bf30d46d800.png)

(https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/tree/master/filters)

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://gaypornhdfree.com/?ref=mygaysites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
I have uninstalled and reinstalled the Adguard app multiple times could doing that interfere with getting updates? Or could that cause the base filter that Alex added a new code specifically for gaypornhdfree.com to no longer work? My iPhone is iPhone 7 Plus operating system 15.7.1 safari version 15.7.1

All I know is now if I click the updating button on the adguard app it saids no updates found. And the website is now detecting my adblocker every time no matter how many refreshes of the page I do. Could someone also please tell me what are the exact filters I must have enabled for in safari protection of the app in order for the added code Alex did to work? 

I have set up the six Adguard extensions on settings-safari of Aduard custom-Adguard general-Aduard other-Adguard privacy-Adguard security-Adguard-social 

each one is enabled 

I have gone to gaypornhdfree.com selected the aA icon on the left of the url bar of safari picked manage extensions and made sure adguard was enabled for advanced protection

I also clicked on adguard on the list shown when you click aA and checked to make sure safari protection specifically for that website is enabled

I have went also to setting-safari and selected

delete history and website data I have also selected close tabs afterwards 


I have added the user rule that Alex told me to add I have done everything I believe I was told of the exact order

but just in case could someone please direct me to the steps again of the exact order 

to make sure I have not missed a step or done it in the wrong order





2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

If someone could please respond of the exact order of the steps needed for this to work I could implement then immediately

issue.title: SCAM domains
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

G

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari, the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

C

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard German filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

https://https__github__com.graha.cloud/ - FAKE GitHub

https://spyinst.net/

http://www.insta-tom.eu5.net/

https://vzlomsn.tk/hack-instagram

https://freebitco.in/signup/ - SCAM

https://click-alfabank-ru.ru/ - SCAM

https://frebitcoin.info/ - SCAM advertising

https://freebitco-in.online/ - SCAM

https://www.instapass.zone/

https://instahack.me/

https://vzlomok.pro/

https://www.vzlomon.ru/topic/9-besplatnyy-vzlom-instagram-instagram/

https://antiban.pro/ru/ - SCAM

https://hacking-passwords.com/instagram

https://xn--b1akmej.com/zakazat-instagram/ - SCAM (from some ip address shows fake error page)

http://okvzlom.eu5.net/

https://www.vzlomon.ru/ - SUSPICIOUS

https://tghacker.org/

https://vzlomfb.com/

https://vbtracker.net/

https://wmcentre.net/catalog/steam/accounts-26837

https://limeside.ru/

https://buy-accs.ru/

https://accsmarket.com/ru

https://akitut.net/

https://hackear-cuenta.com/ru/hackear-instagram/

Also I would recommend to BAN next domains (and all their subdomains):
https://ngrok.com/
https://serveo.net/
https://localhost.run/
https://localxpose.io/

They are not malicious but the are ALWAYS abused by some lamers. For example there three phishing tools, that are using this domains to SCAM people.

[One!](https://github.com/htr-tech/nexphisher) -/- [Two!](https://github.com/yezz123/Phisher) -/- [Tree!](https://github.com/Ignitetch/AdvPhishing) 

If you still think that's not enough to block these domains, just use a github search with the [following query: "phishing"](https://github.com/search?q=phishing) . Every second (or even EVERY) phishing tool will use these resources for their atrocities.

As a conclusion, these domains do more harm than good, so I think that you, as a company specializing in privacy and security, should protect your users from such a primitive phishing method as well.

### Privacy
